channel.title: An Irishman Abroad
channel.description: In each episode, comedian Jarlath Regan is joined by a well known Irish writer, actor, performer, sports person or public figure to discuss their life and shared experience of moving abroad.

As recommended by The Guardian, The Telegraph, The Irish Times and The London Metro -----
In each episode, comedian Jarlath Regan is joined by a well known Irish writer, actor, performer, sports person or public figure to discuss their life and shared experience of living and working abroad.

item.title: Susan Loughnane: Episode 48
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Susan Loughnane is an actress, model, artist and writer who will be most recognisable to Irish audiences for her part of Debbie in Love/Hate. Susan’s path to get to where she is now will be very much unknown to the listener before this. From painting to help fund her way through studying acting in New York to experiencing her lowest ever confidence having just won an IFTA award Susan’s story is one that must be heard. In this interview Susan talks about relapsing into shyness, why she believes that her part on Britain’s Next Top Model was not necessarily a wise decision for her modelling career, how she still enjoys working ‘normal’ jobs occasionally in order to stay grounded and why she values fun over ambition.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair an [...]
item.content:encoded:
Susan Loughnane is an actress, model, artist and writer who will be most recognisable to Irish audiences for her part of Debbie in Love/Hate. Susan’s path to get to where she is now will be very much unknown to the listener before this. From painting to help fund her way through studying acting in New York to experiencing her lowest ever confidence having just won an IFTA award Susan’s story is one that must be heard. In this interview Susan talks about relapsing into shyness, why she believes that her part on Britain’s Next Top Model was not necessarily a wise decision for her modelling career, how she still enjoys working ‘normal’ jobs occasionally in order to stay grounded and why she values fun over ambition.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or contact the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com.

item.title: Donal Skehan: Episode 47
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Many guests on this show have spoken about changing career paths but Donal Skehan’s story takes this to a whole other level. Today Donal is most recognisable as a TV home cook, author and food photographer but many will be unaware of his journey to get there which includes being in bands which brought him two Irish number one hits and losing to Dustin the Turkey in Eurosong, packing everything in and starting from scratch with a new focus on more than just one occasion, letting romance take him to Sweden and working with Jamie Oliver. Donal opens up to Jarlath about how he has dealt with begrudgery towards him, how he deals with worry as well as giving his stance on the place and influence of food in today’s media.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laun [...]
item.content:encoded:
Many guests on this show have spoken about changing career paths but Donal Skehan’s story takes this to a whole other level. Today Donal is most recognisable as a TV home cook, author and food photographer but many will be unaware of his journey to get there which includes being in bands which brought him two Irish number one hits and losing to Dustin the Turkey in Eurosong, packing everything in and starting from scratch with a new focus on more than just one occasion, letting romance take him to Sweden and working with Jamie Oliver. Donal opens up to Jarlath about how he has dealt with begrudgery towards him, how he deals with worry as well as giving his stance on the place and influence of food in today’s media.

item.title: Angela Scanlon: Episode 46
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Angela Scanlon had incredible aspirations for herself from a very early age. In this week’s episode Angela talks about how her childhood struggle with authority shaped her goals, the importance of trust and credibility and she also gives her opinion on the modern day sexualisation and image expectations of women. Angela’s story explains why she believes most people are faking it until they make it, how she created her own fashion business which led to gaining clients such as Louis Vuitton and how she ended up being on Vogue magazine’s one-to-watch list.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or contact the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com.

item.title: Dara O’Briain and Ed Byrne (live from the Vodafone Comedy Festival): Episode 45
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In An Irishman Abroad’s first ever live show in Ireland, Irish comedy legends Dara O’Briain and Ed Byrne sit down together with Jarlath in an intimate theatre at the Vodafone Comedy Festival in Dublin. Dara and Ed deliver some hilarious stories of their long friendship, how being Irish can be an asset abroad, the trials and tribulations of being a working comic and how modern parenting differs from that of previous generations.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com.

item.title: David Coffey: Episode 44
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
How do you go from not being fully invested in your college course in communications to being on the cusp of making it in LA before returning back home once more? David Coffey’s story answers that question. In this week’s episode Dave calls around to Jarlath’s house to chat about his work as a writer pitching ideas to TV executives around the world, how his show Dan and Becs propelled his career forward, his obsession with wrestling and how good timing is vital in one’s career.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or contact the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com.

item.title: Danny O’Reilly: Episode 43
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
The frontman of The Coronas and extremely sound man, Danny O’Reilly joins Jarlath this week to catch up on the last ten years they missed in their friendship and break the news that will change everything for the band. 

Danny discusses how he was at first afraid to admit that music was the career he wanted, his flirtation with the GAA, the lesson he has learned from letting the media into his private life and the band’s big news that puts them along side the likes of Mumford and Sons and Florence and The Machine.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath [...]

item.title: Mick Finnegan: Episode 42
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In one of the most enthralling episodes of An Irishman Abroad to date Mick Finnegan opens up to Jarlath about how he escaped certain death, lived homeless and was the centre of a landmark British court case.

Mick has worked as a coach at Saracens and London Irish rugby clubs. He is the creator of State of Mind Rugby Union charity but his journey to arrive at this point has been more difficult than you can imagine. From living rough on the streets of Dublin to time in custody in London to much, much worse, Mick explains to Jarlath the chances life gave him and how he took them.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair, The Email Laundry and supported by the Mercy Law Resource Centre. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or contact the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Conor McPherson: Episode 41
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description: Olivier Award winning playwright and director Conor McPherson talks candidly about the importance of finding the right focus and drive, why he believes good news can be equally as traumatic as bad and how to pursue your passion while still putting food on the table.  Jarlath and Conor chat about the way in which knowledge affects the purity of art and we get an insight into the process of casting Hollywood stars. Conor speaks about being spotted by an agent, his surprisingly critical view of his smash hit play The Weir, writing for TV and much much more.

item.title: Arthur Mathews: Episode 40
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Arthur Mathews is one of Ireland’s most prolific comedy writers having worked on critically acclaimed material such as Father Ted, Big Train, Brass Eye, Black Books, Toast of London and Harry Enfield and Chums. Arthur talks to Jarlath about writing funny, how the eighties wasted some of the most important years of his life, Roy Keane, being an outsider, living and working with Graham Linehan and the Irish actors who almost appeared on Father Ted.

This episode is sponsored by Bonkers.ie, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Niall Breslin (Bressie) : Episode 39
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Niall Breslin has a story which many people would have never imagined. From having a career in professional rugby for Leinster which led him to representing Ireland in the under 21s World Cup to being the frontman of multiple award-winning band The Blizzards before embarking on a solo career and coaching on The Voice of Ireland. In this gripping episode Niall opens up about suffering with a general anxiety disorder which has led him to becoming an ambassador for mental health in Ireland. Niall also talks about why he was completely broke after a successful career with The Blizzards, why he believes the Brit School drains the ‘rawness’ out of artists before offering some sterling advice on how to fight back against mental health issues.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live sh [...]

item.title: Lenny Abrahamson: Episode 38
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Multi award-winning director Lenny Abrahamson talks about living in a trailer while on a PhD scholarship to Stanford University before giving it all up and returning home to Dublin for reasons much deeper than homesickness. The man behind Adam and Paul, The Garage, Frank and What Richard Did also discusses learning how to fail and why being unable to walk out on a project has made him stronger while also offering up some sage advice to the listeners. 

This episode is sponsored by Vyke, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Dermot O’Leary: Episode 37
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
This week Dermot O’Leary talks to Jarlath about being raised Irish in London as the son of a Wexford hurler, how he values hard work and why he believes that this generation of youths can save the world.

Dermot’s story is a true tale of hard graft from working as a sports reporter who was unable to find his way to football grounds to dominating live television presenting in Britain for the last 15 years since getting his big break which led to hosting on Big Brother’s Little Brother before eventually becoming the host of XFactor. In this episode which was recorded at his BBC Radio 2 studio, Dermot speaks frankly about the importance of honesty, how he handled a now-famous difficult interview with Morrissey and why he likes people underestimating him.

item.title: Tony McCoy: Episode 36
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
One of Ireland’s most successful sportspeople, jockey Tony McCoy, tells his fascinating story of how he lives with a fear of failure which has seen him ride over 4,000 winners without having a fear of injury in a career which has caused him to suffer over 50 broken bones. Tony also talks about how he learned to become a winner, the importance of providing oneself with obstacles in order to be pushed to one’s limits, winning the BBC Sports Personality of the Year award and how his patience is tested with a diet and weight loss regime which has seen him lose 5 pounds in an hour.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, Vyke and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Jane Ní Dhulchaointaigh: Episode 35
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Jane Ní Dhulchaointaigh from Kilkenny is an inventor of a product that Time magazine rated as the 22nd most important invention of the 21st century (10 places above the iPad). Here she tells the story of how Sugru was born out of her realisation that she could not do the thing she’d worked to achieve her whole life. Jane talks about the stigma surrounding failure while explaining her journey of exploration, struggle, faith in other people and the importance of starting small before something can be truly good.

This episode is sponsored by Vyke, Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Steve Collins: Episode 34
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this episode Irish boxing legend Steve Collins talks about his career which spans from his time as a technician in the Guinness brewery, working as an electrician in Boston, being a world champion boxer to running a sheep farm in London while tirelessly working for charity. Steve explains why he believes amateurs ‘box’ and professionals ‘fight’, how he played mind games with Chris Eubank and why he doesn’t trust someone who is unbeaten in their career.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Dylan Haskins: Episode 33
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
From being ignored by a politician as a youngster to running for office himself while still finishing his degree Dylan Haskins has a truly inspirational tale of how living and promoting the Do It Yourself lifestyle has led him to starting his own record label and moving to London to pursue a career in broadcasting. Dylan tells Jarlath his story of how his trust and respect for the Gardaí was put in jeopardy, how the sudden loss of his father influences his outlook on life and why he believes there are many unrealised dreams and ambitions in Ireland.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or by emailing the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

As recommended by The Guardian, The Telegraph, The Irish Times and The London Metro -----
In each episode, comedian Jarlath Regan is joined by a well known Irish writer, actor, performer, sports person or public figure to discuss their life and shared experience of living and working abroad.

item.title: Andrew Maxwell: Episode 32
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this week’s episode comedian Andrew Maxwell discusses what he saw as the conservatism in Ireland that drove him out of the country at an early age which led him to finding his voice in London. Andrew’s determination to never settle for mediocrity while also striving to experience every place he goes has resulted in fascinating stories of conspiracy theories, how leaving Ireland granted him his freedom, being snubbed by critics and how he found a way to lighten the mood while being held at gun point at Area 51.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and The Email Laundr [...]

item.title: Paddy Doyle: Episode 31
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Paddy Doyle is a true Irishman abroad and in this unique episode he tells us his truly gripping story of working as a soldier in the Lebanon, being a care worker for dimentia patients in Ireland, chancing his arm with being offered work in New York, training as a bodyguard in Denmark before arriving in Haiti to protect against kidnappings where he witnessed first hand the devastation of the 2010 earthquake and the guilt that he experienced upon leaving the tragedy to return home to his family.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, McClintock Eyewear and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Sonia O’Sullivan: Episode 30
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
From humble beginnings as a promising young Cork athlete who was as interested in her college education as she was in turning professional to becoming one of the most recognised names in Irish sporting history, Sonia O’Sullivan’s journey literally takes her around the world. Sonia sits down with Jarlath to talk about the events that led to her becoming one of Ireland’s sporting heroes including how she was able to hide an injury to allow herself compete, what it was like to make a costly mistake in an Olympic final and not understanding the connection she had with the Irish public until she retired.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, Keogh’s Crisps, McClintock Eyewear and The Email Laundry. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitte [...]

item.title: Aidan Gillen: Episode 29
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
From being sacked for messing around backstage as a young stage manager in Dublin to appearing on Broadway and gaining starring roles in Queer as Folk, The Wire, Game of Thrones and Love/ Hate, Aidan Gillen’s story is true lesson in how hard work pays off. Aidan talks to Jarlath about how he once escaped being shot for his fashion sense in Arizona, why he has never wanted to be famous and why he believes modern on-screen production is evolving. 

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, The Email Laundry and McClintock Eyewear. For more information on future episodes and live shows follow @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Ronnie Whelan: Episode 28
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
From refusing a Manchester United apprenticeship at the age of 15 to becoming a Liverpool and Ireland footballing legend, Ronnie Whelan’s journey is an honest tale of putting hard work before talent, dealing with homesickness and staying grounded while at the pinnacle of one’s game. Ronnie reflects on his memories of captaining Liverpool on the day of the Hillsborough disaster, how his 15 year playing career came to an end in just 10 seconds and he also delves into stories from the golden era of the Irish football team.
This episode is sponsored by CurrencyFair, McClintock Eyewear, The Plough and Harrow public house, The Email Laundry and The Institute of Irish Studies at The University of Liverpool. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Richard Hughes: Episode 27
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Even if you know nothing about horse racing you really need to hear Richard Hughes tell his story. Despite showing prodigious talent from an early age Jarlath hears how the reigning champion jockey was ultimately forced to leave Ireland and start from scratch. Hear how the lengths he went to control his weight ultimately made him an alcoholic and nearly cost him his life. Hughsie lived to tell the tale and Jarlath was lucky enough to hear it at Kempton just before he rode yet another winner.


This episode is sponsored by CurrencyFair, McClintock Eyewear and The Email Laundry. For more information on future episodes and live shows follow @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly at irishm [...]

item.title: Kian Egan: Episode 26
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Kian Egan has experienced more highs and lows in his 33 years than most of us will experience in three lifetimes. This episode scratches the surface of how he discovered music as a 4 year old in Sligo, signing with Louis Walsh thanks to some classic Irish Mammyism and much much more. Incredibly frank and always brutally honest Kian surprises Jarlath with some truths about the music industry and his role in the biggest boy band in the history of Irish music.

This episode is sponsored by CurrencyFair, McClintock Eyewear and Vyke. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Jack Reynor: Episode 25
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Four years ago Jack Reynor was still in secondary school, dodging classes and refusing to wear the uniform. Today he is regarded as the fastest rising young Irish actor in Hollywood. His journey from being broke in Wicklow to starring in blockbuster movies such as transformers has to be heard to be believed. Hear how shutting up can be the key to nailing an audition, why he brings a copy of Dracula with him everywhere he goes and what he believes to be the main reason behind young stars publicly melting down.

This episode is sponsored by CurrencyFair and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Laura Whitmore: Episode 24
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Laura Whitmore is a lot of things. An internationally respected TV host, showbiz journalist, style icon and perhaps the most understanding guest of the series to date. Hear her journey from commentating on pig racing for East Coast FM to the highest heights of the television industry, her refreshing approach to life, her understanding of what a role model should be and the importance of charm when it comes to men. Jarlath’s conversation with her takes an unexpected twist and Laura’s reaction proves why she’s widely regarded as one of the best in the business.

item.title: Barry Glendenning: Episode 23
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description: Barry Glendenning’s story of moving abroad to pursue a career as a stand up comic before settling as a deputy sports editor with a major newspaper is an intriguing one. In this episode, Barry talks about how he got his big break into journalism by reviewing the Pope’s mass as though it were a rock concert, being frog-marched to perform his first stand up gig which soon led to him competing against Peter Kay, his opinion on the new Ireland managerial setup and why he remains against technology in sport.
item.content:encoded:
Barry Glendenning’s story of moving abroad to pursue a career as a stand up comic before settling as a deputy sports editor with a major newspaper is an intriguing one. In this episode, Barry talks about how he got his big break into journalism by reviewing the Pope’s mass as though it were a rock concert, being frog-marched to perform his first stand up gig which soon led to him competing against Peter Kay, his opinion on the new Ireland managerial setup and why he remains against technology in sport.

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

In this episode, Barry talks about how he got his big break into journalism by reviewing the Pope's mass as though it were a rock concert, being frog-marched to perform his first stand up gig which soon led to him competing against Peter Kay, his opinion on the new Ireland managerial setup and why he remains against technology in sport.This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlathon Twitter or email the show directly onirishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Jerry Flannery: Episode 22
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
How do you make the leap from being one of professional rugby’s elite players to being a mentor at one of the biggest soccer clubs in the world? Jerry Flannery did just that. The Grand Slam and European Cup-winning hooker from Limerick tells his story of glory, despair and fighting to play once again.


This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or email the show directly on irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Andy Lee: Episode 20
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this episode Olympic boxer Andy Lee talks about owing his entire career to a moment of clarity in the corner of a ring, the pressure of fighting in front of an Irish crowd in America, the personal and professional risks that he faces every time he steps up to fight and how the intensity of his training affects his home life.


This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, SquareSpace and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Ardal O’Hanlon: Episode 19
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this episode actor and comedian Ardal O’Hanlon talks about establishing the first major comedy club in Ireland, risking his would-be marriage to move abroad and make a living, the process of being cast as Dougal in the multi award-winning sitcom Father Ted, being cured of his back problems by two preachers upstairs in a Dublin Burger King, playing football with the wrong foot for three years and so much more.  

This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, SquareSpace and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Ken Doherty: Episode 18
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
Former world champion snooker player Ken Doherty tells Jarlath his stories of having to leave Ireland as a young hustler in order to turn professional, nearly being blown up in a gas attack, snorting Bisto gravy granules, almost losing his sight, and addresses corruption among players in the modern game.


This episode is sponsored by Currency Fair, SquareSpace and McClintock Eyewear. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Tom Vaughan Lawlor: Episode 17
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description: Tom Vaughan Lawlor is arguably one of the most recognisable Irish actors in recent years and in this episode of An Irishman Abroad he speaks openly to Jarlath about the events which inspired him to follow in his father’s footsteps and pursue a career in acting which saw him move to London thirteen years ago. Tom talks about his most applauded role as Nidge in Love/ Hate and his struggles with the imposition of his character’s persona on his personal state of mind as he lives with pressures of the lack of financial control that comes with being an actor while also dealing with the struggle of not wanting to let his family down.

item.title: Owen O’Neill: Episode 16
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this episode Jarlath sits down with the award winning writer, actor and comedian Owen O’Neill. He went from a terrace in Tyrone to the Tony Awards on Broadway. Owen tells the best of the stories from his journey. From being struck by lightning to chancing his arm at being a footballer, from working as a nervous labourer while writing poems for pints in the mid-eighties to turning down the offer of a Royal Variety performance. He even manages to squeeze in his appearances on the Conan O’Brien and David Letterman shows. It’s a hell of a ride


This episode is sponsored by currencyfair.com. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.co [...]

item.title: Tom Dunne: Episode 15
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
As a broadcaster Tom Dunne has become known for producing hours of compulsive listening. In this episode the tables are turned as he gives Jarlath a rare insight into the series of life changing events that lead to him touring the world as frontman of the band Something Happens. Tom tells Jarlath about a journey woven together through a series of gripping stories of friendship, cut-throat business, divorce and the joy of returning home. 


This episode is sponsored by currencyfair.com. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Derval O’Rourke: Episode 14
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this episode World and European medalist Derval O’Rourke speaks to Jarlath about dealing with the psychological toll of a career threatening injury, living with an overwhelming desire to win and being robbed of a medal by a drugs cheat. She gives an insight into the life of an Olympian and the training necessary to become the fastest woman over hurdles in Irish history.

This episode is sponsored by currencyfair.com. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Dylan Moran: Episode 13
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this rare and frank conversation with stand up comedian and writer Dylan Moran, he talks about how self employment has allowed him to make a living on his own terms. The Navan-born star of Black Books and Shaun of the Dead speaks passionately about his fascination with global affairs, his opinion of social media and his discomfort with the concept of having followers.


This episode is sponsored by currencyfair.com. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on Twitter or you can email the show directly at irishmanabroadpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Robert Sheehan: Episode 12
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
This week we get a rare glimpse into the life of BAFTA winning actor Robert Sheehan. From his early beginnings as a teenager acting in Song for a Raggy Boy, to his breakthrough role in Misfits. We learn how he came to play his most celebrated character of Darren Treacy in the smash hit Irish crime drama Love/Hate. The London based actor opens up to Jarlath about the struggle with homesickness, dealing with isolation and the difficulties of holding down relationships while working in multiple continents and the joy of coming home.


This episode is sponsored by currencyfair.com. Get updates on future episodes and live shows by following @jarlath on [...]

The London based actor opens up to Jarlath about the struggle with homesickness, dealing with isolation and the difficulties of holding down relationships while working in multiple continents and the joy of coming home.

item.title: Chris O’Dowd: Episode 10
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description:
In this rare long-form interview with actor Chris O’Dowd, his journey from the basement setting of the UCD Drama Society to the waiting rooms of Hollywood auditions is explored through a series of fascinating and surprising stories. The star of The IT Crowd, Bridesmaids and Gulliver’s Travels talks to Jarlath about the brave decisions that he made which helped him along the way. 


This episode is brought to you by currencyfair.com and was recorded in central London. Get updates on future podcasts and live shows by following @jarlath on twitter.

item.title: Michael Smiley: Episode 7
item.dc:creator: anirishmanabroad
item.description: BIFA award winning actor Michael Smiley gives Jarlath a deeply honest insight into being a homeless single father in London, his national identity crisis, living a “scratch card life”, Simon Pegg and much more. Michael opens up about how the extremities of a person’s character can help shape them as an actor. This interview was recorded at the BAFTA Members’ Club in London.

item.title: Dara O’Briain: Episode 5
